Package com.ultreon.mods.lib.core.item

Class LootContainerItem

java.lang.Object
net.minecraft.world.item.Item
com.ultreon.mods.lib.core.item.LootContainerItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.minecraft.world.level.ItemLike, net.minecraftforge.common.extensions.IForgeItem
public class LootContainerItem extends net.minecraft.world.item.Item
An item that gives the player items from a loot table when used, similar to a loot bag. A default loot table must be specified, but ultimately an NBT tag is used to determine which loot table to pull items from. This could be extended to not use loot tables (see getLootDrops(ItemStack, ServerPlayer)).
Since:
3.0.2

      lootTable - The loot table to assign to the stack

    • getLootTable

      protected net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation getLootTable(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack)
      Get the loot table the item will use. If a loot table if specified in NBT and it is valid, that table is returned. Otherwise, this returns defaultLootTable.
      Parameters:
      stack - The item
      Returns:
      The loot table which will be used

    • getLootDrops

      protected Collection<net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack> getLootDrops(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack heldItem, net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player)
      Get the items to give the player when used. By default, this uses the loot table specified in the NBT of heldItem. Can be overridden for different behavior. This implementation is similar to AdvancementRewards.grant(ServerPlayer).
      Parameters:
      heldItem - The loot container item being used
      player - The player using the item
      Returns:
      A collection of items to give to the player
